meanings.definition: The act of withdrawing or retreating from a position or decision.
meanings.sent1: After facing strong opposition, the politician's backdowns surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: The company's backdowns on the new policy upset many employees.
meanings.sent3: The backdowns of the team captain led to a lot of teasing from the other players.
meanings.sent4: Her backdowns in negotiations left her with a weaker position.
meanings.sent5: The backdowns of the army in battle cost them the victory.

meanings.definition: A reversal or change in one's stance or opinion.
meanings.sent1: The sudden backdowns in his beliefs shocked his friends.
meanings.sent2: Her backdowns on the issue made her seem indecisive.
meanings.sent3: The backdowns in his fashion choices were quite amusing to his colleagues.
meanings.sent4: His backdowns on the matter were like a complete U-turn.
meanings.sent5: The backdowns in her attitude were noticeable to everyone around her.
